 reserved area

Detailed Description

Definition of the superblock data type.

It contains global information about the file system layout, namely the size and the location of the remaining parts.

It is divided in:

  • header - that contains data about the type, the version, the name, the size in number of physical blocks and the consistency status
  • inode table metadata - concerning its location, size in number of blocks in use and inodes and number of free inodes; the inode table is primarily conceived as an array of inodes, however, the free inodes form a double-linked list whose location of the head and the tail are also provided (dynamic FIFO that links together, using the inodes themselves as nodes, all the free inodes)
  • data zone metadata - concerning its location, size in total number of data clusters, number of free data clusters and its three main reference components: the insertion and retrieval caches for an easy access temporary storage of references (static structures resident within the superblock itself) and the location of the head and the tail of the general repository of free data clusters double-linked list (dynamic FIFO that links together, using the data clusters themselves as nodes, all the free data clusters whose references are not in the above mentioned caches).

Field Documentation

uint32_t mstat

flag signaling if the file system was properly unmounted the last time it was mounted

  • PRU - if properly unmounted
  • NPRU - if not properly unmounted
